page.title: 04Signs of Moy's Past
page.content: FAIRY STEPS _ along the" Old Old A9" road. CAUSEWAY - a story tells a causeway went from the shore to the larger island in the loch. CHURCHYARD _ walled _ green iron gates _ well kept _ neat. Oldest grave 26 June 1763, most recent 1982. Youngest death 6 weeks, oldest 84 years. CASTLE RUINS of first Moy Hall on Isle of Moy in Loch Moy. GRANITE MONUMENT on Isle of Moy erected by wife of 23rd Chief _ Aeneas in his memory. MONUMENT situated down drive of Moy Hall was erected by Alexander 26th Chief in 1840 in memory of his wife Mary Glas. WORLD WAR II _ safe area for evacuees _ several housed in Factor's house. 1940 aircraft dropped 4 bombs aimed at Moy Hall _ nearest fell close to Hall breaking windows.
